00019 #include <termios.h>
00020 #include <stdio.h>
00021 #include <errno.h>
00022 #include <sys/types.h>
00023 #include <sys/stat.h>
00024 #include <sys/select.h>

00026 #include <sys/time.h>

00038 
00039 int tmcl_init_rsXXX(TMCLInterface *iface) {
00040 
00041     struct termios options;
00042     struct termios checkopts;
00043 
00044     DEBUG("tmcl_init_rsXXX\n");
00045 
00046     if(tcgetattr(iface->handle.fd, &options) == -1) {
00047         perror("tcgetattr");
00048         return -1;
00049     }
00050 
00051     /* Set the speed */
00052     if(cfsetispeed(&options, B9600) == -1) {
00053         perror("cfsetispeed");
00054         return -1;
00055     }
00056     if(cfsetospeed(&options, B9600) == -1) {
00057         perror("cfsetospeed");
00058     }
00059 
00060     /* Enable the receiver and set local mode... */
00061     options.c_cflag |= (CLOCAL | CREAD);
00062 
00063     options.c_cflag &= ~CRTSCTS;
00064 
00065     /* No parity (8N1) */
00066     options.c_cflag &= ~PARENB;
00067     options.c_cflag &= ~CSTOPB;
00068     options.c_cflag &= ~CSIZE;
00069     options.c_cflag |= CS8;
00070 
00071     /* Disable echo and canonical mode and ...*/
00072     options.c_lflag &= ~ECHO;
00073     options.c_lflag &= ~ECHOE;
00074     options.c_lflag &= ~ICANON;
00075     options.c_lflag &= ~ISIG;
00076 
00077     /* Disable some other disturbing options */
00078     options.c_oflag &= ~OPOST; /* Set output to raw mode. All other c_oflags are ignored now */
00079     options.c_iflag &= ~INLCR; /* Do not map NL to CR. */
00080     options.c_iflag &= ~ICRNL; /* Do not map CR to NL. This fixes the annoying bug where binary 0x0D was converted to 0x0A. */
00081     options.c_iflag &= ~IXON;  /* Disable software flow control */
00082 
00083 
00084     /*
00085      * Now set the attributes
00086      * Note: Success of tcsetattr doesn't mean necessarily that everything 
00087      * was set correctly. To be correct we have to do 'tcgetattr' and compare 
00088      * the options
00089      */
00090     if( tcsetattr(iface->handle.fd, TCSAFLUSH, &options) == -1 ) {
00091         perror("tcsetattr");
00092         return -1;
00093     }
00094 
00095     /* Check if everything was set correctly */
00096     if(tcgetattr(iface->handle.fd, &checkopts) == -1) {
00097         perror("tcgetattr");
00098         return -1;
00099     }
00100 
00101     if(options.c_iflag != checkopts.c_iflag) {
00102         DEBUG("Setting of c_iflag failed: %X != %X", options.c_iflag, checkopts.c_iflag);
00103         return -1;
00104     }
00105     if(options.c_oflag != checkopts.c_oflag) {
00106         DEBUG("Setting of c_oflag failed: %X != %X", options.c_oflag, checkopts.c_oflag);
00107         return -1;
00108     }
00109     if(options.c_cflag != checkopts.c_cflag) {
00110         DEBUG("Setting of c_cflag failed: %X != %X", options.c_cflag, checkopts.c_cflag);
00111         return -1;
00112     }
00113     if(options.c_lflag != checkopts.c_lflag) {
00114         DEBUG("Setting of c_lflag failed: %X != %X", options.c_lflag, checkopts.c_lflag);
00115         return -1;
00116     }
00117 
00118     /* Now flush the port */
00119     if( tcflush(iface->handle.fd, TCIOFLUSH) == -1 ) {
00120         perror("tcflush");
00121         return -1;
00122     }
00123 
00124     return 0;
00125 }
00126 
00127 
00128 int tmcl_open_rsXXX(TMCLInterface *iface, const char *filename, void *pointer) {
00129 
00130     DEBUG("tmcl_open_rsXXX: %s\n", filename);
00131 
00132     if((iface->handle.fd = open(filename, O_RDWR | O_NOCTTY | O_NONBLOCK )) == -1) {
00133         perror("open");
00134         return -1;
00135     }
00136 
00137     DEBUG("Filedescriptor: %d\n", iface->handle.fd);
00138     /* Now init the interface */
00139     return tmcl_init_rsXXX(iface);
00140 
00141 }
00142 
00143 int tmcl_close_rsXXX(TMCLInterface *iface, void *pointer) {
00144 
00145     if( close(iface->handle.fd) == -1) {
00146         perror("close");
00147         return -1;
00148     }
00149 
00150     return 0;
00151 }
00152 
00153 
00154 int tmcl_write_rsXXX(TMCLInterface *iface, const void *buf, int length, void *pointer) {
00155 
00156     ssize_t num_bytes;
00157 
00158     DEBUG("tmcl_write_rsXXX to fd %d\n", iface->handle.fd);
00159 
00160     num_bytes = write(iface->handle.fd, buf, length);
00161 
00162     if(num_bytes != TMCL_DGRAM_SIZE_RSXXX) { /* Test if all bytes have been written */
00163         perror("write");
00164         return -1;
00165     }
00166 
00167     return 0;
00168 }
00169 
00170 int tmcl_poll_rsXXX(TMCLInterface *iface, char *buffer, void *pointer) {
00171 
00172     fd_set        input;
00173     struct timeval  timeout;  /* How long select() should wait for input */
00174     //    struct timespec timewait; /* How long to wait for reading after select() triggers */
00175     ssize_t       length = 0;
00176     ssize_t       tmplength = 0;
00177     uint8_t       tmpbuf[TMCL_DGRAM_SIZE_RSXXX+1]; /* Reserving one byte more than necessary. See below */
00178     int            n, ret;
00179 
00180     DEBUG("tmcl_poll_rsXXX()\n");
00181     ret = 0;
00182 
00183     /* Initialize the timeout structure */
00184     timeout.tv_sec  = iface->timeout_sec;
00185     timeout.tv_usec = iface->timeout_msec * 1e3;
00186 
00187     /* Inititalize the timewait structure */
00188     //    timewait.tv_sec  = iface->timewait_sec;
00189     //    timewait.tv_nsec = iface->timewait_msec * 1e6;
00190 
00191     FD_ZERO(&input);
00192     FD_SET(iface->handle.fd, &input);
00193 
00194     /* Using select instead of pure read to be able to set a timeout for reading */
00195     n = select(((iface->handle.fd)+1), &input, NULL, NULL, &timeout);
00196 
00197     switch(n) {
00198     case -1:
00199         perror("RSXXX - select()");
00200         ret = -1;
00201         break;
00202     case  0:
00203         fprintf(stderr, "TIMEOUT in read_rsXXX()\n");
00204         ret = -1;
00205         break;
00206     default:
00207         /* We have input */
00208         assert(FD_ISSET(iface->handle.fd, &input)); /* select() didn't fail so this should really be true */
00209 
00210         bzero(buffer, TMCL_DGRAM_SIZE_RSXXX+1);
00211         while(length < TMCL_DGRAM_SIZE_RSXXX) {
00212 
00213             bzero(tmpbuf, TMCL_DGRAM_SIZE_RSXXX+1);
00214 
00215             //            /* Give the board some time to fill the input buffer */
00216             //            if(nanosleep(&timewait, NULL) == -1) {
00217             //                perror("nanosleep");
00218             //            }
00219 
00220             /* Try to read one byte more than necessary. If we get it there was some unprocessed date.
00221              * This shouldn't be. */
00222             tmplength = read(iface->handle.fd, tmpbuf, TMCL_DGRAM_SIZE_RSXXX+1);
00223             if(tmplength == -1) {
00224                 perror("RSXXX - read()");
00225                 return -1;
00226             }
00227 
00228             length += tmplength;
00229 
00230             if(length > TMCL_DGRAM_SIZE_RSXXX) {
00231                 DEBUG("Too many bytes read: %d bytes > TMCL_DGRAM_SIZE_RSXXX", length);
00232                 return -2;
00233             }
00234             DEBUG("tmcl_poll_rsXXX read 0x%X %X %X %X %X %X %X %X %X\n", tmpbuf[0], tmpbuf[1], tmpbuf[2], tmpbuf[3], tmpbuf[4], tmpbuf[5], tmpbuf[6], tmpbuf[7], tmpbuf[8]);
00235             memcpy((buffer + (length-tmplength)), tmpbuf, tmplength);
00236 
00237         } /* End while() */
00238         assert(length == TMCL_DGRAM_SIZE_RSXXX);
00239         ret = length;
00240     } /* End switch() */
00241 
00242     DEBUG("tmcl_poll_rsXXX returns %d\n", ret);
00243     return ret;
00244 }
